details.title: COVID-19 UPDATES FROM NOV 11
details.content:
Delhi reports over 8,500 fresh cases, highest single day spike so far and more such updates from across India.
(Click here for November 11 COVID-19 updates)

details.title: Poor AQI of Delhi can worsen pre-existing conditions, recovered COVID-19 patients
details.content:
'Patients discharged six months ago, especially those who had developed pneumonia, come back with issues such as breathlessness and heart problems. Some can develop Interstitial lung disease (ILD) as well which is also known as pulmonary fibrosis. Exchange of Oxygen and Carbon Dioxide may become difficult,' Dr S.P Byotra, Pulmonologist from the Sir Ganga Ram Hospital said.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Uttarakhand BJP MLA succumbs to COVID-19 in Delhi
details.content:
Uttarakhand BJP MLA Surendra Singh Jeena (file photo) passes away at Sir Gangaram Hospital in Delhi, where he was undergoing treatment for #COVID19.

He was an MLA from Salt constituency in Almora district. His wife had passed away a few days back following a heart attack. pic.twitter.com/laDqlrriZ8

— ANI (@ANI) November 12, 2020

details.title: Global update | UK becomes fifth country to exceed 50,000 coronavirus deaths
details.content:
The United Kingdom on Wednesday became the fifth country in the world to record more than 50,000 coronavirus-related deaths. Figures from the British government showed that 595 more people in the country died within 28 days of testing positive for the virus, the highest daily number since May.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Telangana records 1,196 new COVID-19 cases, five deaths
details.content:
A small dip in cases was registered under GHMC limits as only 192 cases were reported on the day, as opposed to over 200 cases in the past six-seven days.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: COVID-19 touched almost every household in Delhi, says High Court
details.content:
The Delhi High Court noted that the daily number of new COVID-19 cases received for November 10 was at 8,593 and 'still counting' and the number of containment zones in the city were 4,016.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Union Minister Smriti Irani recovers from COVID-19
details.content:
I have tested negative for COVID. Would like to extend my grateful thanks to everyone for their good wishes & prayers.

— Smriti Z Irani (@smritiirani) November 12, 2020

details.title: Global update | Pakistan's Lahore sees peak pollution as coronavirus surges
details.content:
A thick blanket of smog enveloped Pakistan's cultural capital of Lahore on Wednesday, prompting officials to warn that tens of thousands of the city's residents risk respiratory disease and eye-related problems while doctors urged people to stay at home.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Schools in Tamil Nadu won't reopen from November 16: CM
details.content:
The Tamil Nadu Chief Minsiter also withdrew permission given to religious gatherings, social, political, entertainment, cultural and educational functions, and the meetings related to these events, to start from November 16 with not more than 100 participants.

CM EPS announces : Reopening of schools is deferred for now; the orders for reopening of Classes 9, 10, 11 and 12 from November 16 is withdrawn @xpresstn @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/VACc5f4z1S

— T Muruganandham (@muruga_TNIE) November 12, 2020

details.title: Junior doctors of Hyderabad's Gandhi Hospital go on strike, demand resumption of non-COVID services
details.content:
• The strike began on Wednesday at 2 pm after JUDA representatives unanimously came to the conclusion that the situation wasn’t changing.
  • One of the major contentions of the students is that lakhs of patients would be benefitted if the hospital resumes non-COVID services, and that it would be a blessing for PG students who have lost the last seven months due to the pandemic.

details.title: India adds 47,905 new cases to its COVID-19 tally
Global update | US hospitals again under pressure with COVID-19 on the rise
details.content:
After several weeks of rapidly rising coronavirus cases, hospitals around the United States are once again overwhelmed, forcing local authorities to take new measures to cope with the pandemic.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: COVID-19 caseload in India nears 87 lakh mark with 47,905 new infections
details.content:
India saw a single-day increase of 47,905 infections taking the country's COVID-19 caseload to 86,83,916, while the number of people who have recuperated from the disease have surged to 80,66,501, according to the Union Health Ministry data updated on Thursday. The coronavirus death toll climbed to 1,28,121 with 550 new fatalities, the data updated at 8 am showed.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: PIC | Woman in a mask!
Firecracker sales fizzle out in Hyderabad due to COVID-19, rains
details.content:
Blaming poor sales on a double whammy of the ongoing pandemic and the recent floods, 55-year-old Sanjay Kumar Bhop from Shanti Fireworks in Osmangunj, says, 'This is the first time that there is such a lull in the market just days before the festival.'
(FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: No lockdown this weekend in Lucknow due to festivals
details.content:
• All markets in Lucknow district will remain open from today till 14th November in light of Dhanteras and Diwali celebrations, as per the official press release.
  • On July 14, the Uttar Pradesh Government imposed a weekend lockdown in the state to contain the spread of COVID-19 pandemic.
  • The lockdown in the state is put into place on every Friday from 10 pm to 5 am on Monday.
  • For this week, the 'weekly lockdown' in the state will now be from 15-17 November.

(Inputs from ANI)

details.title: Serum Institute, ICMR complete enrolment in phase-III trials for COVID-19 vaccine
details.content: SII and the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) are collaborating on the clinical trials of the vaccine in the country. While ICMR has funded the clinical trial site fees, SII is taking care of other expenses for the Covishield. (FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Smell, taste changes provide early indication of COVID-19 community spread: Study
Global update | California nears million COVID-19 cases
details.content:
California will be the second state — behind Texas — to eclipse a million known cases. The grim milestone in a state of 40 million comes as the U.S. has surpassed 10 million infections.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

Vaccines contain:

?Antigen
?Preservatives
?Stabilizers
?Surfactants
?Residuals
?Diluent
?Adjuvant

Learn more about how each ingredient works ????https://t.co/lIq4zTwA8d #VaccinesWork pic.twitter.com/IfzGl3MCdC

— World Health Organization (WHO) (@WHO) November 11, 2020

details.title: Delhi High Court concerned over rise in COVID-19 cases in the Capital
details.content:
• The high court said the Delhi government cannot be allowed to play with the lives of citizens and the state is responsible for the health of citizens for which others have to chip in, including private hospitals.
  • Delhi recorded its biggest single-day jump of 8,593 COVID-19 cases on Wednesday that took its infection tally to over 4.59 lakh people, while 85 new fatalities pushed the national capital's death toll to 7,228.
  • Delhi High Court seeks to know why Delhi Govt has chosen 33 private hospitals & not picked the remaining private hospitals for reserving 80% of ICU beds for COVID19 patients. Court asks ASG Sanjay Jain to take instructions & fixes the matter for hearing later today.
  • High Court says that the Delhi Government's September notification regarding reserving beds is outdated, there is a complete change in circumstances in Delhi as COVID19 infection cases are on a rise.

details.title: Global update | USD 500 million to be pledged for Covid-19 vaccine access at Paris Peace Forum
details.content:
Several countries and foundations are set to pledge more than $500 million Thursday for a global pool aimed at ensuring equitable access to coronavirus tests, treatment and vaccines for all nations, organisers of a French forum said.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Don't forget your mask this festive season
Aatmanirbhar Bharat Rozgar Yojana for COVID recovery phase
details.content: FM announces new Aatmanirbhar Bharat Rozgar Yojana to incentivse creation of new employment during COVID-19 recovery phase

details.title: COVID norms go for a toss in Kolkata
details.content: West Bengal: COVID19 norms go for a toss as commuters cram local trains during peak hours

details.title: Delhi govt bans Chhath Puja celebrations at ghats to contain COVID-19 spread
details.content: "In the view of safety and to avoid crowd gathering amid the pandemic, we have decided to ban community Chhath Puja celebrations near the ghats this year. The officials have been directed to take strict action against people not following COVID-19 protocols," Jain told reporters here. The COVID-19 cases have rapidly increased in national capital and touched a new peak by crossing 8,000 positive cases in the past 24 hours.

details.title: FM announces stimulus 3.0, says indicators showing recovery in economy
details.content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, while making new stimulus announcements under Atmanirbhar 3.0 on Thursday, declared the launch of a new scheme to incentivse the creation of new employment during COVID-19 recovery phase. Talking at a press conference at the National Media Centre, Delhi, the Finance Minister said that there were "quite a few indicators showing a distinct recovery in the economy,"

details.title: Sitharman announces Rs 900 crore grant for COVID-19 vaccine research
details.content: Sitharaman said the grant does not cover the actual cost of vaccine and distribution expenses, which will be made separately as and when the vaccine is available.

details.title: CEC on allegations of 'slow counting' of votes in Bihar
details.content:
#WATCH | To ensure social distancing, there were 7 people on a counting desk this time as compared to the normal number of 14 with an additional 33,000 polling booths: Sunil Arora, Chief Election Commissioner, on a question of allegations of 'slow counting' pic.twitter.com/dkLvg2UpHb

— ANI (@ANI) November 12, 2020

details.title: Himachal records 170 new COVID cases
details.content: Himachal Pradesh reports 170 new COVID19 cases & 185 cured cases today, taking the total number of positive cases to 27,588 so far, including 5,586 active cases, 21,571 recoveries & 403 deaths till date: Department of Health, Govt of Himachal Pradesh

details.title: Bihar COVID tally
details.content: 523 new COVID19 positive cases reported in the state on 11th November. The total number of active cases in Bihar is 6,915: State Health Department

details.title: Jr doctors protest in Hyderabad
details.content:
“We spoke to Health Minister on 31st October regarding the resumption of non #COVID19 services at Gandhi hospital. He gave verbal assurance to restart these services within 10 days. After waiting for over 10 days, we began indefinite strike yesterday,” says Telangana JUDA member https://t.co/xtTshHbO8A pic.twitter.com/WOgVR2reA0

— ANI (@ANI) November 12, 2020

details.content:

— TNIE Kerala (@xpresskerala) November 12, 2020

details.title: 2116 new cases reported in Karnataka
details.content: Karnataka reports 2,116 new COVID19 cases, 3,368 discharges and 21 deaths. Total positive cases in the State rise to 8,55,912 including 8,14,949 discharges and 11,474 deaths. Active cases stand at 29,470: State Health Department

details.title: Festive rush amid pandemic restrictions
details.content:
As #deepavali2020 nears, hundreds of people who were away from their homes, booked tickets and started leaving to their native places to celebrate the festive season with their family.
Visuals from Egmore Railway Station, Chennai.

Express Photos | @haisat2005 @xpresstn pic.twitter.com/DLGMAwa9W7

details.title: Rajasthan COVID tally
details.content: Rajasthan reports 2,176 new COVID19 cases, 13 deaths and 1,804 recoveries today. Total cases in the state rise to 2,19,327 including 2,032 deaths and 1,99,943 recoveries/discharges. Active cases stand at 17,352

details.title: Jammu and Kashmir COVID tally
details.content: 617 new COVID19 cases reported in Jammu and Kashmir today; 226 from Jammu division and 391 from Kashmir division. Total number of cases now at 1,00,968 including 5,578 active cases, 93,824 recoveries, and 1,566 deaths: Govt of Jammu and Kashmir

details.title: State-run Gandhi Hospital to be open for non-COVID services after 8 months
details.content:
After 8 months of being an exclusive Covid -19 treating facility of #Telangana , Gandhi Hospital will now be open for non-covid services as well.
The Director of Medical Education has issued instructions to the Superintendent to make arrangements for the same before 21st Nov pic.twitter.com/paDQWSjvFg

— TNIE Telangana (@XpressHyderabad) November 12, 2020

details.title: Rajasthan reports 13 more COVID-19 deaths, 2,176 new cases
details.content:
Rajasthan reported 13 more COVID-19 fatalities on Thursday, taking the death toll to 2,032 as 2,176 new cases pushed the state's infection tally to 2,19,327.

According to a Health department bulletin, 17,352 patients are currently undergoing treatment in the state, and the number of recoveries stands at 1,99,943.

details.title: Sachin Pilot tests positive
details.content:
I have tested positive for Covid 19.

Anyone who may have come in contact with me over the last few day, please get yourselves tested.

Am taking appropriate doctoral advice. Hope to recover soon.

— Sachin Pilot (@SachinPilot) November 12, 2020

details.title: Goa's COVID-19 count up by 107; tally at 45,605
details.content: With the addition of 107 fresh cases of COVID-19, the tally of infections in Goa reached 45,605 on Thursday, an official from the health department said. While the coastal state did not report any casualties during the day, 192 patients recovered from the infection, the official said.

Country's COVID-19 recovery rate improves to 92.89 per centhttps://t.co/KEmmUi7r62

— All India Radio News (@airnewsalerts) November 12, 2020

details.title: Actor and politician Chiranjeevi tests negative
details.content:
Three days after testing positive for Covid, Actor and politician @KChiruTweets shared his Covid negative report on Thursday. This was ascertained by set of 3 tests.
His initial test was deemed to be incorrect and faulty@NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/KcotBhTDMQ

— TNIE Telangana (@XpressHyderabad) November 12, 2020

details.title: Ahmedabad reports 199 new COVID-19 cases, 160 recoveries
details.content: Ahmedabad recorded 199 new cases of coronavirus in the last 24 hours, the highest for a district in Gujarat on Thursday, while 160 patients recovered from the infection, said the state Health Department. With this, Ahmedabad district's tally of positive cases rose to 44,690, said a release by the department.

details.title: Tamil Nadu reports 2,112 fresh COVID-19 cases, 25 more fatalities
details.content: Tamil Nadu on Thursday reported 2,112 new COVID-19 cases and 25 deaths, taking the tally to 7,52,521 and the toll to 11,440. Of the fresh infections, Chennai reported 565, Coimbatore 190, Chengelpet 148, Tiruvallur 120 and the remainder was scattered across the state, a health department bulletin said.

The #COVID19 pandemic hasn't dampened the festive spirit as workers were seen enthusiastically making sweets and savouries ahead of #Diwali.
Visuals from Palayamkottai in Tamil Nadu's Tirunelveli#Deepavali #Diwali2020

Express Photos | @KARTHIKALAGU86 @xpresstn pic.twitter.com/8me4DxhaNz

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) November 12, 2020

details.title: Delhi updates
details.content:
Cases of #COVID19 dips in Delhi, 7053 new positives. However fatality count goes up, 104 succumbs to the virus.
Active cases above 43K. @NewIndianXpress @TheMornStandard pic.twitter.com/dVAa5suLdx

— Somrita Ghosh (@Somrita_Ghosh) November 12, 2020

details.title: 1,817 new coronavirus cases, 20 deaths in Chhattisgarh
details.content: Chhattisgarh's COVID-19 infection count surged to 2,07,740 on Thursday after 1,817 people tested positive for the viral infection, an official said. With 20 new fatalities, the death toll climbed to 2,527, he said.

details.title: 622 COVID-19 cases, 360 recoveries in Pune district; 19 die
details.content: Pune district reported 622 new coronavirus cases in the last 24 hours, taking its tally to 3,30,112 on Thursday, a health official said. With 19 fresh fatalities, the death toll in the western Maharashtra district rose to 8,141, he added.

details.title: Himachal Pradesh reports 765 fresh COVID-19 cases, 6 more deaths
details.content: Himachal Pradesh reported six more COVID-19 fatalities on Thursday, taking the death toll in the state to 406, while 765 new cases pushed the infection count to 28,184. Three deaths were reported from Shimla, two from Mandi and one from Hamirpur, according to the Health department data issued here.

details.title: Bengal logs record recovery of 4,453 COVID patients
details.content: West Bengal on Thursday reported the highest single-day recovery of 4,453 COVID-19 patients, taking the total number of cured people to 3,81,149, the health department said in a bulletin.

details.title: Bihar reports 5 more COVID deaths, 523 new cases
details.content:
Five more persons died of COVID-19 in Bihar on Thursday, raising the death toll to 1,167, while 523 fresh cases took the tally to 2,25,499, the health department said in a bulletin.

Altogether 536 patients also recovered from the disease, taking the total number of cured people to 2,17,958, the bulletin said.
